parallel
Class ReduceOpBase

java.lang.Object
  parallel.ReduceOpBase
public class ReduceOpBase
extends java.lang.Object

A class implementing the Reduce concept in parallel/distributed computing. Before thread groups wishing to participate in reducing ops can use this class, a "setup" must occur either via a call to ReduceOpBase.addThread(t) or (recommended) ReduceOpBase.addThread(groupname, t). Each of the added threads to execute a reducing operation then calls result = ReduceOpBase.getInstance([groupname]).reduce(mydata, op);. The threads wait at this point until all threads added actually reach this point, at which time, they execute the reduction operation and return the data to all calling threads. Once threads start calling the reduce(data,op) method it is forbidden for other threads to call addThread([name,]t) method (behavior becomes undefined). If a thread wishes to leave, it may do so by calling ReduceOpBase.removeCurrentThread([groupname]) The op in reduce(data,op) operation can differ for each thread, meaning that one thread can participate in the reduction doing a minimization operation, while another can simultaneously be doing a maximization operation. If a thread other than the ones originally entering the reduce-op (via setup) calls the reduce(data,op) methods then a ParallelException will be thrown. Notice that this implementation is modeled after the ComplexBarrier class in this package.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

Method Detail

addThread

public static void addThread(java.lang.Thread t)
method must be called before reduce(data) can be used. It should be invoked only once for each group of threads which to execute the reduce(data) call.

Parameters:
t - Thread

addThread

public static void addThread(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.Thread t)
method has the same purpose as the addThread(t) call, except that it creates a separate ReduceOpBase instance that can be referenced by the getInstance(name) call, so that several reduce-op objects can co-exist in the same program.

Parameters:
name - String the name with which the ReduceOpBase object can be later got
t - Thread a thread that will be coordinated on this object

removeCurrentThread

public static void removeCurrentThread()
                                throws ParallelException
removes the current thread from having to synchronize on the default reducer.

Throws:
ParallelException

removeCurrentThread

public static void removeCurrentThread(java.lang.String name)
                                throws ParallelException
removes the current thread from having to participate in the reduce with the given name.

Parameters:
name - String
Throws:
ParallelException - if the reduce group name does not exist or if the thread was not a participant in this barrier.

getInstance

returns the instance that was created by a prior call to addThread(t)

getInstance

public static ReduceOpBase getInstance(java.lang.String name)
returns the instance that was created by a prior call to ReduceOpBase.addThread(name,t)

Parameters:
name - String
Returns:
ReduceOpBase

removeInstance

public static void removeInstance(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ParallelException
remove the instance named after the argument passed in from the known data-base of reduce instances (maintained by this class). The caller must ensure that no threads will call the reduce(o) method for the instance to be deleted again, otherwise deadlocks may arise (some threads waiting on the reduce, and the remaining threads will never be able to call the reduce(data) method again).

Parameters:
name - String
Throws:
ParallelException - if there was no such ReduceOpBase instance in the data-base of reduce instances.

reduce

public java.lang.Object reduce(java.lang.Object data,
                               ReduceOperator op)
                        throws ParallelException
main method of the class. It waits until all participating threads enter this method, and it guarantees that if a thread enters this method again before all threads have exited the previous reduce() call it will wait first for all the other threads to exit and then will proceed.

Parameters:
data - Object - the data of this thread to participate in the reduce
op - ReduceOperator - the operator to apply to the data
Returns:
Object - the result of the reduce operation
Throws:
ParallelException - if current thread is not registered via addThread
